program_description: The Flood Control Assistance Account Program is intended to provide funding for flood planning and flood projects, as well as emergency response funding.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: FCAAP uses a 25% cash match approach, which must be incurred within the timeframe of the grant agreement.  Note: Match is 20% for emergency response grants.
funding_limitation_description: Generally a limit of $150,000  In some cases an eligible entity could receive up to $500,000 in a single biennium
funding_award_duration: Until the close of the biennium (June 30, odd numbered years)
additional_application_information: n/a

program_description: FBD is a multi-benefit program that addresses flood hazards to communities while also improving floodplain and ecosystem functions.  The program is intended to address large-scale actions and include multiple benefits.
eligible_projects_description: Project vary widely and are custom fit to the needs of a community or watershed.
match_requirement_description: Previous investments in the project or related elements such as designs, land acquisitions, feasibility studies may be used as match.  Standard cash match and in-kind are also eligible match.
funding_limitation_description: Grants are not limited by dollar value, but work must be completed in 2-3 years
additional_application_information: Project proposal period opens in the fall of odd numbered years and closes in July of even numbered years.  Funding awards are made in the summer of even numbered years and are based on the state capital budget.

match_requirement_description: Previous investments in the project or related elements such as designs, land acquisitions, feasibility studies may be used as match.  Standard cash match and in-kind are also eligible match.
funding_limitation_description: Grants are not limited by dollar value, but work must be completed in 2-3 years
additional_application_information: Project proposal period opens in the fall of odd numbered years and closes in July of even numbered years.  Funding awards are made in the summer of even numbered years and are based on the state capital budget.

match_requirement_description: Previous investments in the project or related elements such as designs, land acquisitions, feasibility studies may be used as match.  Standard cash match and in-kind are also eligible match.
funding_limitation_description: Grants are not limited by dollar value, but work must be completed in 2-3 years
additional_application_information: Project proposal period opens in the fall of odd numbered years and closes in July of even numbered years.  Funding awards are made in the summer of even numbered years and are based on the state capital budget.

funding_program: Coastal and Marine Habitat Restoration Grants (NOAA)
program_description: This funding supports projects that promote productive and sustainable fisheries, improve the recovery and conservation of protected resources, and promote healthy ecosystems and resilient communities through the restoration of coastal habitat. Applicants may submit one or more projects to be completed in one, two, or three years.
eligible_projects_description: Note: See NOAA website for funding details as project funding is often tied to specific project purpose(s).
funding_limitation_description: Up to $4M over a three year cooperative agreement
additional_application_information: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending appropriations.

program_description: The 319 grants provide funding for nonpoint source pollution projects to improve and protect water quality.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: $250K grant limit with In-kind match contribution;  $500K grant limit with Cash-only match contribution.
additional_application_information: Apply via the annual Water Quality Combined Funding Cycle process.

funding_program: Coastal and Marine Habitat Restoration Grants (NOAA)

Applicants may submit one or more projects to be completed in one, two, or three years.
eligible_projects_description: Note: See NOAA website for funding details as project funding is often tied to specific project purpose(s).
funding_limitation_description: Up to $4M over a three year cooperative agreement
additional_application_information: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending appropriations.

program_description: Provides assistance to small forest landowners to fix inadequate or blocked culverts on logging roads in order for salmon to access streams.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: n/a
additional_application_information: n/a

funding_program: Coastal and Marine Habitat Restoration Grants (NOAA)
program_description: This funding supports projects that promote productive and sustainable fisheries, improve the recovery and conservation of protected resources, and promote healthy ecosystems and resilient communities through the restoration of coastal habitat. Applicants may submit one or more projects to be completed in one, two, or three years.
eligible_projects_description: Note: See NOAA website for funding details as project funding is often tied to specific project purpose(s).
funding_limitation_description: Up to $4M over a three year cooperative agreement
additional_application_information: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending appropriations.

program_description: This program funds two categories of action: 1) projects that improve the capacities of costal jurisdications to adapt or recover from extreme weather and climate related hazards, and 2) projects that restore habitat to strengthen the resilience and decrease vulnerability of coastal communities to the same.

funding_limitation_description: Up to $2M over a three year cooperative agreement
additional_application_information: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending appropriations.

funding_limitation_description: Up to $2M over a three year cooperative agreement
additional_application_information: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending appropriations.

funding_program: Aquatic Invasive Plant Management Grant Program (Ecology)
program_description: The Aquatic Invasive Plant Management Grants (AIP) provides financial and technical support for the eradication and control of invasive, non-native aquatic plants that threaten the health of lakes, rivers, and streams.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: $30,000 for planning grants; $75,000 for implementation grants; Each applicant is limited to $75,000 per annual grant cycle; Early infestation projects are limited to $50,000 per project.
additional_application_information: n/a

program_description: The Aquatic Invasive Plant Management Grants (AIP) provides financial and technical support for the eradication and control of invasive, non-native aquatic plants that threaten the health of lakes, rivers, and streams.
